div1.p: Carter receives orders for his next assignment.

div1.head: Letter from A.H. Glennan to Henry Rose Carter, April 27, 1915
div1.p:
JKC
OFFICE OF THE SURGEON GENERAL
IN REPLYING
ADDRESS THE SURGEON GENERAL
U. S. PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
WMT
TREASURY DEPARTMENT
BUREAU OF
THE PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
WASHINGTON
April 27, 1915. Assistant Surgeon-General Henry R. Carter,
U. S. Marine Hospital,
Baltimore, Maryland.
Sir:

On or about May 15th, you are hereby directed to
proceed to Montgomery and elsewhere in Alabama to
continue the investigations of the influence of im-
pounded waters on the health of communities. You
will then, as may be necessary, proceed to Columbia
and other points in South Carolina to continue like
studies.

Prior to taking up this work you will report at
the Bureau, May 13th, for conference.

You are authorized to incur any necessary ex-
penditures for typewriting your official reports and
correspondence, the work to be done at current rates.
Any apparatus necessary to your investigations may
be shipped by you by express.

On the completion of this duty, you will rejoin
your station, Baltimore, Maryland.

Respectfully,
TH Glennan
Acting Surgeon-General.
JWK.

The expenses incurred in carrying out the foregoing
instructions are hereby authorized.
